For those with certain issues it leaves little time for leisure or down time. when leaving the company unused sick time is not payable if not used. No chance to move up from level 1 employment in many cases.

job_title: Unit Services Representative in Hackensack, NJ
pros: Excellent benefits and the hospital always gifts their employees. The pay is very good, too.
cons: The staff I worked for was very unprofessional and was extremely entitled. I was running two icu units and worked for about 60-80 nurses. Most of the RNs were rude and petty if they didn’t get their way. If I was ordered to pick something up for a patient, and the hospital was out of stock, it was automatically my fault. These nurses did everything they could to manipulate and sabotage my position at the hospital. DO NOT work in the MICU/CCU department. Very toxic!

review_title: Stable, growing company but employee satisfaction needs a lot of work. Image over people.
pros: Good pay and decent benefits, great reputation in healthcare.  Mostly good peers to work with.  Not closely or overly micromanaged.
cons: There are programs/incentives for 'employee satisfaction' on a corporate level but on a human level they could care less.  Very bureaucratic.  Managers are far removed and you end up with people who can't/haven't/don't know how to the job telling you how best to do it.  When people aren't doing their job properly instead of being reprimanded, the work is pushed to someone who performs better and the underachievers continue to do less.  Pay is based on job title alone and not merit or performance.  Benefits/perks dwindle every year.  No room for advancement for non-clinical employees- when a higher paying job become available they downgrade the title and pay so they can higher new staff at a cheaper rate.  New duties are added with ZERO training for them... I could go on...

review_title: Hackensack is a  money making machine which does not treat their nurses well, nurses should be compensated more .
pros:
Good training
Good benefits
Good  employee retention
Good education incentive
Good teamwork
Good parking
Good schedule
Wellness program needs improvement
cons:
Nurses are not well compensated
12hours shift break  to short only 30mins
Below industry standards
The gym owned by hackensack needs to be discounted  more for employees
Promotion from within using meritocracy needs to start STAT
Self scheduling needs to be done in action not in word supervisors are switching days for RNs without their consent

job_title: Emergency Trauma Department Unit Clerk in Hackensack, NJ
pros: Great pay and benefits are not bad. If you are not a multi-tasker you will definitely learn to be. Most of the male nurses are very friendly.
cons: Broke my back for the ER.. I worked three double shifts (11PM-3:30PM)  three days in a row on top of being sick (Diagnosed with bronchitis and prescribed medication by one of ER doctors) and drowsy during an overnight shift 30 minutes before my shift ended (11Pm-7AM) I was sent home and told i potentially might be terminated. Following day I wrote out a statement to fight my side of the story for the management. the following week I am terminated and suggested by management I can write out an appeal to keep my position to the vice president. completed the appeal and turned in to human resources, turned out i wasn't qualified for appealing being under 90 day probation. Nobody will have your back when needed no matter how much energy you dedicate to the company.

review_title: Would give zero stars if allowed.
pros: None. The money is not worth the heartache. Sorry I have nothing nice to say. It’s making me write at least 20 words, but I really have nothing nice to say.
cons: Nepotism.  Favoritism. Unequal treatment of employees.  Management does not care about staff.  You work your butt off and almost never get a break.  Sure they pay ok, but not worth it when you leave there either wanting to cry or scream.  Don’t get sick because they will threaten you or simply fire you.  They are more worried about their imagine than actual patient satisfaction.  Management is changing constantly.  High ranking management from the department of patient care hired a family member who was previously fired and placed into a high management position, which he continually makes mistakes and doesn’t treat nurses in a way that is conducive to a good work environment.  Actually, hostile working environment.  Nurses are so stressed they treat each other badly.

review_title: All they care about is their image but treats employees horribly
pros: Great salary and benefits.  MAGNET Institution.
cons: They don't care about their employees.  They pay great but they overwork you.  I fear for my license and my job security.  Worked here for 11 years and now is never the same as it was since the management changed.  I must say, as you become more senior and get paid more, be very careful because as soon as they find something against you, they wouldn't think twice about firing you.  And definitely good for their budget because they will easily replace you with a fresh graduate with of course a lot less to pay hourly.  Oh and I forgot to mention, they are GREEDY.  They accept all patients then if entire hospital beds are full, they will put patients on the hallways.  And oftentimes, patients are transferred from ER to a hallway and guess what, a SURPRISE for them that they don't have a room and claims that they weren't informed.  I wonder if other hospitals do that?  If they could put patients on top of each other, believe me they would.  All they care about is MONEY.  A very hectic shift everytime and you have to get out on time or else, you will be subjected to a disciplinary action.   But then in the meantime if you forget to chart something, you will be in trouble.  Hopefully, not to the point of losing your license.

review_title: Overall I would say that it was a good hospital to work in.
pros:
Excellent pay, great benefits, 12 hour shifts for nursing staff which allows for time off. 
Some of the staff is amazing and very knowledgeable.  Most of the staff will always go out of their way to help you if needed.
cons:
Work on top of work, always the mentality to do more than humanly possible. Over-time is strongly frowned about and one will hear about it for sure.
Parking for employees is mostly off site and you have to be bused in. One must allow extra time to get into work on time.

pros: I work with an affiliated clinic(s)Really goood working enviromnent. This depends on location you are placed. For trainning i was placed in North bergen where the office manager was the very nice, but some staff were not the nicest. i was moved to union city location where I was suppose to train for another month there and then relocate permanently to Clifton, but did not happen. I ended up staying in Union city, which is the best thing thats happened to me. I feel at home and hope to stay there a good while.
cons: Schedule is subject to change without notice. If you have family/kids this is difficult.

review_title: It's a good hospital, but management causes toxic environment
pros: Most of my coworkers are hardworking and I enjoyed working with them.  We do little things to try to make it feel like we are a family (not that the managers ever contribute or participate).
cons: Management plays favorites; they are very cliquey and too bad if you are not on their good side.  It's impossible to take off when you want or need to.  Management talks down to the little people; they know the economy is bad and constantly remind us we are replaceable.  They micromanage us; they sit in their office and watch us work, then they will come out to boss you around.  We have half a dozen supervisors in our department, all running around saying different things, each one with different ideas about every minute detail of how we should work, how the workflow should be.  They sit in their offices and spy on us all day, then they each come out and complain about how we are working and try to correct us, sometimes contradicting what another supervisor tells us to do.  They tell us what time to go to lunch.   If it is overly busy, they won't let you go to lunch, even if you came in at 6 am and it is already 1pm.  We are constantly shortstaffed because everyone hates working here.  We are forbidden from telling anyone else outside our department that we are shortstaffed when they ask us why the orders are taking so long to come out.  I am sure they would whip and beat us if it weren't illegal to assault your employees- "why can't you work faster, you pharmacy monkey."

review_title: Ridiculous Clinical Cancer Research Management Team
job_title: Clinical Research Data Coordinator in Hackensack, NJ
pros: Health benefits and Beautiful new Cancer Center
cons:
The management team at the Clinical Cancer Research center is ridiculous. Very disorganized management team with no fear vision of a management plan. Always implement new ideas that never fall through. 

Very biased management team that have favorites and provide little to no training to new research employees. You are basically set up for failure before you start. Training is so bad and they are quick to blame you for anything that goes wrong AND expect you to learn things on your own for the most part and give you things to do  even when they know you have not been trained to do so.

The pay is very low for all the work and numerous studies they want you to work on and some of the PI's have empty ego's  larger than than the Atlantic Ocean. Some of the Clinical research Nirses have favorite coordinators who are still there and haven't moved up the ladder. No growth for career advancement! 

WARNING to future Research ApplicNts: if you want to SLAVE away as a Clinical Research DATA Coordinator with low pay, then go ahead and apply at this institution. You will work your life off! Don't say you have not been warned!!!

pros:
Large teaching hospital
Decent salary (not compared to NYC) but for NJ
cons: Disorganization; The company does not inform you on training commitments; Hired for part-time and never told about full-time commitment (over 40 hours a week) for 8 weeks; Horrible communication

job_title: Medical and Clinical Laboratory Technologist in Hackensack, NJ
pros: Great place to learn. I worked in the blood bank where we saw stuff that most hospitals only read about in text books.
cons: Horrible management, very controlling superiors. They tell you when to take a break. Just not a great place to work. I came into this hospital because it was my dream to work there but resigned after six months because I was loosing sleep at night because of the unnecessary stress.

job_title: Unit Clerk in Rochelle Park, NJ
pros: I believe the fact that helping people in itself is a positive. They train people and have people 24/7 incase you have any questions about anything. The people that currently work their(some) are ok.
cons: The management is going in a direction that most people do not like. They will try to get away with things they are not allowed to do. Its hard to move from somewhere if you work hard because most bosses want to keep you.

review_title: Not what it used to be!
job_title: Registered Nurse BSN in Hackensack, NJ
pros: Great salary and benefits Great support from co-workers.
cons: Poor upper level management.  They will not train their own nurses in another specialty. Not loyal to long time employees.  The trend has been outsourcing of departments and numerous  layoffs!!!!  Job security for a job well done is a thing of the past at HUMC.

review_title: Great Place To Work (For Hard Workers)
pros: Good Salary, Education opportunity, Unbelievable Career Growth for those who work very hard. People are not shy to complement you for hard work or for professionalism. Work hard and your bosses will lift you.
cons: Off-site parking for the first 5 years requiring a shuttle to the hospital from the lot and vice versa every day. Managers and supervisors are very powerful, which can be bad at times.

review_title: Politics and poor morale cripple laboratories
pros: Broad learning opportunities. Non management coworkers very supportive. Tasks are easy. Job security.
cons: Employee morale is nonexistent. Laboratory management clueless about employees. Zero opportunities to advance because seniority even in absence of skill trump all other criteria for promotions. Micro management by managers with huge chips on their shoulders. Employee appreciation events are an insult and a joke.

pros: I want to know more about Hackensack how good it is and show how good I am by giving care professionals to those need
cons: I've been working 15 years now as a CNA 6 years in casitas care center 9 years at my present job sylmar rehab.center no complaints received yet as far as my ability to work

job_title: Occupational Therapist in West Orange, NJ
pros: Management is very understanding and it is a very friendly environment. Great place to learn about various diagnoses and everyone truly enjoys working with each other.
cons: Very Fast paced which is expected however difficult at times due to the size of the hospital. The shuttle is at times a challenge, as there may not be enough for the end of the day or a great deal of time spent waiting during the middle of the day for additional riders. Not a huge problem though.

review_title: Not what it cracked up to be
pros: Decent Medical, Dental and Vision insurance if the company does not mess it up for you or your family
cons: Most departments are very understaffed at HUMC. Employee responsabilities overlap and the right hand does not know what the left hand is doing. Work is often duplicated. Management and staff can be condescending. The facility is not clean. Supervisors and managers tend to not put in the work for their departments. There is often talk about change but nothing changes.

review_title: You work very hard for not much recognition. They will always find a way to ask you to do more without compensation.
pros: I love the people I work with, everyone works hard and tries to make the best of things. Hackensack has a great name so it's well recognized.
cons: Lack of recognition and more and more expectations of nursing staff. They may have the best rating but it still treats staff not so well.

review_title: Very busy hospital that will always keep you challenged
pros: The hospital is constantly growing, and our health benefits are good. We get merit raises now, but this is only beneficial as long as you're on management's good side.
cons: They took away our sick time. Also, they make decisions without consulting the employees who are affected even though they don't do the job themselves.

pros: Have some benefits, workload, patients, working atmosphere, willing to go above and beyond, Family oriented environment. Very safe job ,no lay-off
cons: Part time employees who are working on steady schedule  do not have any benefits. Benefits should be based on amount of hrs working per week.

pros: Flexibility with scheduling and benefits.
cons:
Management does not focus or care about it's staff. There are various issues with communication from an ineffective office manager. Confidentiality is non-existent within HR and gossiped about between management and staff. Making a complaint against "favorites" who have no consequences for their actions, therefore reflects on your job performance which can lead to termination.

The environment is toxic which can lead to employees being extremely unhappy and unfocused. It's a "watch your back" kind of mentality which is never healthy for any employee. Expressing your thoughts and concerns to higher management is an on going issue that will never be resolved.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Richmond Hill, GA
pros: Great opportunities for advancement within the staff nursing world. Comprehensive facility. Great co-workers. High retention facility.
cons: They need to hire nurse anesthetists. At the time that I was there, I was leaving the facility to go to school to become a CRNA. They didn't hire CRNAs at the time I was there.

job_title: Patient Care Technician in Hackensack, NJ
pros: Great work environment, room for growth. Honest work ethic is not only glorified but rewarded. I learn something new everyday here. I have met so many employees with an average span of 20 years at this hospital. Just amazing.
cons: If your not serious about this job and about improving your skills. You will have a hard time. HR seems to do well by filtering out these types of people.

review_title: Rapidly expanding company but leaves the little guy behind
pros: Highly competitive salary, large coverage area and options for work, good corporate oversight on middle management, good corporate values.
cons: Middle management is often unqualified and only looking to protect themselves. Employees are ignored unless complaints are filed with corporate departments. Despite the organization rapidly expanding, there are very few opportunities for the individual employee to grow.

pros: Good education and training classes. Lots of new technologies and resources for nurses/
cons: Administration doesn’t care about employees and doesn’t truly know how it is to work on the floors because they are never there. They just want results no matter how they achieved and how understaffed place is.

review_title: Very fast paced and competitive environment.
pros: Friendly and dedicated staff members.  Many programs available for community to be involved.  Benefits are excellent with much variety of incentives available
cons: Depending on the number of staff available, it is often difficult to take time off,  Work process are  occasionally very confusing.

pros: one of the highest paying places in Bergen county has good benefits and paid time off and decent retirement plan
cons: it has gotten  to big and management forgets that the employees make this a great hospital management needs to listen to the workers more

review_title: A nice place to work at but not a lot of growth
pros: Great benefits, Great tech for IT, and amazing cafeteria options and seating
cons: little room for growth, work gets repetitive after a while, management tends to ignore employee suggestions

pros: A good place to acquire a verity of experiences as a starter
cons:
Family atmosphere= micromanagement 
Seniority trumps everything, lack of respect, people are expected to be overworked (the culture) and under appreciated (by level of seniority), most staff are stucked here forever with associates degrees & 10, 20 years of experiences doing the same thing. Toxic work environment with lots gossip & connections behind doors.  Horrible insurance coverage after the merger.

review_title: Working at Hackensack Medical has it's highs and lows.
pros: The Salaries are pretty good.
cons: There are many bullies working here.  The culture is not what you know but who you know.  Some directors/managers border on unethical behavior.  They are big on reengineering - no one is safe.

pros: They have appreciation meetings once in a while for employees in individual department.
cons: It is hard to advance in your career unless you downgrade yourself to a less suitable position.

pros: great benefits, and salary.  directors have unlimited days off, but you need to get your work done.
cons: Cut throat employees/environment. especially after merger.  Absolutely horrible experience.  lack of integrity and ethics.

job_title: End User Support in Westwood, NJ
pros: benefits if you can get them (and your any race but white)
cons:
Management: no direction, no training, bad management.
Benefits: was lied to that my medical application was completed by HR. When it came time to see if it was approved, I found out the application was half way completed . Had to wait 3 more months to get it.

pros: One of the best hospitals around, terrific benefits, decent work life balance.
cons: Not much room for advancement, personal patient care gets lost in the void of the big corporate atmosphere as with most bigger corporations but is a shame to see happen in healthcare

pros: the only plus here is the ample parking;
cons: Working here you are under appreciated and put down by other employees, otherwise, some of the patient's families are rude and you have to put up with them, the benefits are abysmal.

job_title: Client Service/Technical Support Analyst in Hackensack, NJ
pros: Very nice environment. The staff is awesome
cons: I feel that the hospital is no longer health care institution. I feel that I have to label it as a corporation. Numbers are more important than workers

pros: Excellent benefits, great place to work. Lots of support from peers. New Equipment. Excellent merit increases for job welldone
cons: Very busy, at times too much on everyone's plate. Too far from my home. Parking is an issue for employees.

review_title: How to tolerate a good job
pros: excellent pay, nice staff, good educational programs
cons: The staff ratio is bad, The staff communication with administration is poor

pros: Good pay and benefits. It's not far from the city. They help you if you are a nursing student
cons: They don't treat you fair.. They have no respect for employees with lower degree. Parking too far

pros: Exposure to all aspects of dentistry, learn a lot
cons: Difficult patients, management does not listen to residents about improving the program.

pros: Doctors and most coworkers are pleasant to work with. Tuition assistance is available.
cons: The management is grossly incompetent. Company culture is extremely toxic. Employees are treated as expendable. Many nurses are rude and do not center patient care. Salary and raises is extremely low.

pros: Benefits, pay, hours and promotions
cons: Managers supervising medical staff and have no clinical background.

pros: It the best place to be employed great benefits professional coworkers and a good salary
cons: Parking, cafeteria food,traffic,work attire can’t leave facility

pros: Very flexible with schedule especially if you're a student.
